      • almostEquals

        public static boolean almostEquals​(float[] one,
                                   float[] two,
                                   float eps)
        Compare two float arrays for almost equality. To be equal, each pair of items of the arrays can differ at most by eps.
        Parameters:
        one - the first array
        two - the second array
        eps - the tollerance
        Returns:
        true when the arrays are almost equal

      • almostEquals

        public static boolean almostEquals​(double[] one,
                                   double[] two,
                                   double eps)
        Compare two double arrays for almost equality. To be equal, each pair of items of the arrays can differ at most by eps.
        Parameters:
        one - the first array (null is ok, NaN not!)
        two - the second array (null is ok, NaN not!)
        eps - the tolerance (0 is ok)
        Returns:
        true when the arrays are almost equal

      • removeFromSortedArray

        public static int[] removeFromSortedArray​(int[] array,
                                          int element)
        remove the element from the array assuming the array is sorted. The removal is done keeping the ordering. The method returns the new array.
        Parameters:
        array - a sorted array (read-only)
        element - the element to be removed
        Returns:
        the new array or the original array if the element was not found

      • addToSortedArray

        public static int[] addToSortedArray​(int[] array,
                                     int element)
        Add the element to a sorted array. The method return a new sorted array containing the specified element. The original array is returned if the element was already part of the array.

        Expects a sorted array! Behaviours is rather unpredictable if array is not sorted.

        Parameters:
        array - the sorted array
        element - the item to be added to the array
        Returns:
        a new array containing the element or the original one if element is already present
